00012 ///               which represents the tree nodes.

00017 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00018 /// SPuzzleTrace::SPuzzleTrace
00019 ///
00020 /// @description  This is the default struct constructor which initializes class
00021 ///               member variables.
00022 /// @pre          None
00023 /// @post         None
00024 ///
00025 /// @limitations  It actually does nothing...
00026 ///
00027 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00028 SPuzzleTrace::SPuzzleTrace()
00029 {
00030 }
00031 
00032 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00033 /// SPuzzleTrace::~SPuzzleTrace
00034 ///
00035 /// @description     This is the destructor which frees up dynamic memory used
00036 ///                  by the class. It deletes all the STreeCalls stored in
00037 ///                  s_depths.
00038 /// @pre             None
00039 /// @post            None
00040 ///
00041 /// @limitations     None
00042 ///
00043 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00044 SPuzzleTrace::~SPuzzleTrace()
00045 {
00046     while( s_depths.count() > 0 )
00047     {
00048         if( s_depths.first() == NULL )
00049             s_depths.takeFirst();
00050         else
00051             delete s_depths.takeFirst();
00052     }
00053 }
00054 
00055 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00056 /// SPuzzleCall::SPuzzleCall
00057 ///
00058 /// @description  This is the default class constructor which initializes class
00059 ///               member variables.
00060 /// @pre          None
00061 /// @post         None
00062 ///
00063 /// @limitations  None
00064 ///
00065 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00066 SPuzzleCall::SPuzzleCall()
00067 {
00068     s_returnValue = 0;
00069 }
00070 
00071 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00072 /// SPuzzleCall::~SPuzzleCall
00073 ///
00074 /// @description     This is the destructor which frees up dynamic memory used
00075 ///                  by the class. It deletes all the STreeCalls stored in
00076 ///                  s_children and all the ITreeLines stored in s_lines.
00077 /// @pre             None
00078 /// @post            None
00079 ///
00080 /// @limitations     None
00081 ///
00082 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00083 SPuzzleCall::~SPuzzleCall()
00084 {
00085     /*
00086     while( s_children.count() > 0 )
00087     {
00088         if( s_children.first() == NULL )
00089             s_children.takeFirst();
00090         else
00091             delete s_children.takeFirst();
00092     }
00093     */
00094 
00095     while( s_lines.count() > 0 )
00096     {
00097         if( s_lines.first() == NULL )
00098             s_lines.takeFirst();
00099         else
00100             delete s_lines.takeFirst();
00101     }
00102 }
00103 
00104 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00105 /// SPuzzleCall::operator[]
00106 ///
00107 /// @description     This overloaded operator is meant to allow an abstraction
00108 ///                  of the STreeCall. Using the [][] its cells can be accessed
00109 ///                  as though it were a two dimensional array of QStrings.
00110 /// @pre             None
00111 /// @post            None
00112 ///
00113 /// @limitations     None
00114 ///
00115 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00116 IPuzzleLine *SPuzzleCall::operator[](int index)
00117 {
00118     if( index >= 0 && index < s_lines.count() )
00119         return s_lines[index];
00120     return NULL;
00121 }
00122

00135 IPuzzleLine::~IPuzzleLine()
00136 {
00137 }
